intro: Piptocoma rufescens var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf piptocoma, is a species native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a shrub or small tree characterized by its lanceolate,革质 (leathery) leaves that are often pubescent on the underside. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, woody fruits containing one or two seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation projects.
